subject: Track and Field
Records and Achievements
lead_paragraph: In 1973, Matt Centrowitz of Power Memorial High School in Manhattan ran a mile in 4 minutes 2.7 seconds. On Saturday, his son, Matthew, will go after the family high school record. Officials of the Reebok Grand Prix announced yesterday that Matthew, an 18-year-old high school senior from Annapolis, Md., would run the mile in their meet Saturday at Icahn Stadium on Randalls Island in New York. A month ago, the younger Centrowitz set a Penn Relays high school record of 4:08.38 for the mile. Last weekend, he ran 4:04.09 for 1,600 meters, the equivalent of 4:05.5 for the mile. His father, the track coach at American University, had a career best of 3:54.94 for the mile. The son is bound for the University of Oregon, his father’s alma mater.
